revised_title: Investigation of Atmospheric Transmission in the 1 to 14μ Region
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
tldr: This study investigates the transmission of the atmosphere for radiation between 1 and 14μ, focusing on the effects of visibility and humidity. The researchers found that transmission varies with visibility, with longer wavelengths showing less impact. They also observed absorption bands caused by water vapor, carbon dioxide, and other rare constituents. The results help to understand the relationship between atmospheric transmission and weather conditions.
